intro: Mattiastrum emiri, commonly known as the Eleri's mistplant, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, velvety leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Its unique morphology and restricted habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Mattiastrum emiri is considered endangered, highlighting the need for its protection.
